subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
Mitochondrial ROS Regulation and Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory defects that increase ROS, creating a feedback loop driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitochondrial ROS generation causing oxidative damage to mtDNA and proteins, leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production causing mtDNA damage and mitochondrial morphological changes that accelerate aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA deletions causing respiratory defects and increased ROS, contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial oxidative stress causing mtDNA mutations and respiratory chain decline, leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation and clonal expansion of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory chain deficiency and ROS increase.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS generation causing mtDNA deletions and lipid peroxidation, linking oxidative damage to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced mtDNA mutations impairing respiratory chain and increasing ROS, driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS increase as causal in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation and segregation of mtDNA mutations impairing bioenergetics and promoting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on clonal expansion of early-life mtDNA mutations increasing mutational load and mitochondrial dysfunction with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial genome instability and loss of mtDNA maintenance enzymes to mtDNA deletions and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses mtDNA mutation accumulation, mito-nuclear interactions, and epigenetics affecting mitochondrial function and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Vicious Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutation accumulation impairing NADH/NAD+ redox and mitochondrial energy metabolism causing female reproductive aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Regulation and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Romo1-mediated mitochondrial ROS production from complex III driving replicative senescence via DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Regulation and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production modulated by caspase-2 and complex III dysfunction accelerating mitochondrial oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Lon protease regulation of mitochondrial protein quality control and its dysregulation leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Programmed Cell Death Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial fusion/fission balance, fragmentation, and dynamics regulating mitochondrial function, ROS, and apoptosis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Impairment and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitophagy as mitochondrial quality control, with AMBRA1 regulation impairment causing accumulation of damaged mitochondria and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Impairment and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes interplay between DNA damage and mitophagy decline leading to accumulation of dysfunctional mitochondria and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Impairment and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial quality control mechanisms including mitophagy and mitochondrial-derived vesicles as central to brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Coenzyme Q Biosynthesis Deficiency and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on clk-1 mutation impairing endogenous coenzyme Q biosynthesis, altering mitochondrial respiration and redox balance affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Control Region Remodeling and Healthy Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes somatic mtDNA control region mutations remodel replication origins, maintaining mitochondrial function and promoting healthy aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Systemic Aging Phenotypes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory chain decline, apoptosis, and systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Oxidative Damage Accumulation and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation to mitochondrial DNA, proteins, and lipids impairing mitochondrial function and cellular homeostasis with age.
